channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report E-2025050007
item.description:
Report E-2025050007

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-28T03:42:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-30
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 30, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN1719 had a crack and released approximately one (1) gallon to the dock floor. R+L Carriers remediated the dock floor, then retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 to perform a tote transfer. The crew transferred the tote and broke down the damaged tote for containerization in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025040640
item.description:
Report E-2025040640

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-22
  • City: BAYTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A truck was parked over the weekend at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Baytown, TX. Upon unloading the truck the following week it was discovered that one of the drums had reacted, causing the drum to fail and approximately 4oz of material to be leaked into the cargo portion of the truck. The spill was remediated and the drum was overpacked into a 851H2 along with the spill cleanup materials.

item.title: Report E-2025040563
item.description:
Report E-2025040563

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T01:00:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-25
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When our driver started unloading product was pouring out of the QRB assembly. he shut down but by the time pressure came off the line there was 10 gallons that spilled, 3 of which went in to the catch bucket and 7 on the ground. When they pulled it back to the operating center and inspected it with safety representatives they found that the external valve quick release bonnet had been disassembled incorrectly.
